Package com.stehno.ersatz.cfg

Interface Response

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ErsatzResponse
    public interface Response
    Used to configure the provided response to an HTTP request.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Response allows​(HttpMethod... methods)
      Shortcut method for adding values to the "Allow" header.
      Response body​(java.lang.Object content)
      Defines the request content to be sent back to the client.
      Response body​(java.lang.Object content, ContentType contentType)
      Defines the request content to be sent back to the client, along with its content-type.
      Response body​(java.lang.Object content, java.lang.String contentType)
      Defines the request content to be sent back to the client, along with its content-type.

      Configures the response as "chunked", with the specified chunking configuration.

      Configures the response as "chunked", with the specified chunking configuration.

      Used to specify the response code for the response.

      Used to add multiple cookies to the response, with the provided names and values.

      Registers a response body encoder for this response, which will override any matching encoders configured globally (or shared).

    • Method Detail

      • body

        Response body​(java.lang.Object content)
        Defines the request content to be sent back to the client. In the case of MultipartContent, the content-type will also be set.
        Parameters:
        content - the content object
        Returns:
        this response

      • body

        Response body​(java.lang.Object content,
              java.lang.String contentType)
        Defines the request content to be sent back to the client, along with its content-type. Multipart responses may be specified using this method; however, the content-type will need to specify the boundary string and the boundary will need to be specified in the MultipartContent configuration as well.
        Parameters:
        content - the content object
        contentType - the content type
        Returns:
        this response

      • body

        Response body​(java.lang.Object content,
              ContentType contentType)
        Defines the request content to be sent back to the client, along with its content-type. Multipart responses may be specified using this method; however, the content-type will need to specify the boundary string and the boundary will need to be specified in the MultipartContent configuration as well.
        Parameters:
        content - the content object
        contentType - the content type
        Returns:
        this response

      • header

        Response header​(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String... value)
        Used to add a header to the response with the given name and value.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        value - the header value
        Returns:
        this response

      • headers

        Response headers​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> headers)
        Used to add multiple headers to the response.
        Parameters:
        headers - the headers
        Returns:
        this response

      • allows

        Response allows​(HttpMethod... methods)
        Shortcut method for adding values to the "Allow" header. These values will be appended to the existing header.
        Parameters:
        methods - the allowed HTTP methods
        Returns:
        this response

        Parameters:

        value - the cookie value
        Returns:
        this response

        Parameters:
        code - the response code
        Returns:
        this response

      • delay

        Response delay​(long time)
        Used to specify a delay in the response time for the request. The response will not be returned to the client until the delay has passed.
        Parameters:
        time - the response delay in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this response

      • delay

        Response delay​(long time,
               java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Used to specify a delay in the response time for the request. The response will not be returned to the client until the delay has passed.
        Parameters:
        time - the response delay in the specified unit
        unit - the time unit to use
        Returns:
        this response

      • delay

        Response delay​(java.lang.String time)
        Used to specify a delay in the response time for the request as a Duration string.
        Parameters:
        time - the delay time as a string
        Returns:
        this response

      • getDelay

        long getDelay()
        Used to retrieve the response delay time.
        Returns:
        the response delay time in milliseconds

      • chunked

        Response chunked​(@DelegatesTo(value=ChunkingConfig.class,strategy=1)
                 groovy.lang.Closure closure)
        Configures the response as "chunked", with the specified chunking configuration.
        Parameters:
        closure - the chunking configuration
        Returns:
        a reference to this response

      • chunked

        Response chunked​(java.util.function.Consumer<ChunkingConfig> config)
        Configures the response as "chunked", with the specified chunking configuration.
        Parameters:
        config - the chunking configuration
        Returns:
        a reference to this response

      • getHeaders

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getHeaders()
        Used to retrieve the configured response headers.
        Returns:
        the response headers

      • getCookies

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getCookies()
        Used to retrieve the configured response cookies. The map keys will be the cookie names, while the values will be either the cookie value as as String, or a Cookie object.
        Returns:
        the response cookies

      • getContent

        byte[] getContent()
        Used to retrieve the configured response content. The content will be converted to a byte array based on the encoder configured for the content-type and content object type; if no encoder is found, the toString() method will be called on the content object and its bytes will be used.

        If no content exists, an empty array will be returned.

        Returns:
        the response content (encoded)

      • getCode

        java.lang.Integer getCode()
        Used to retrieve the configured response code.
        Returns:
        the response code

      • encoder

        Response encoder​(java.lang.String contentType,
                 java.lang.Class objectType,
                 java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object,​byte[]> encoder)
        Registers a response body encoder for this response, which will override any matching encoders configured globally (or shared).

        param contentType the response content-type to be encoded

        Parameters:
        contentType - the response content type to be encoded
        objectType - the response object type to be encoded
        encoder - the encoder function
        Returns:
        a reference to this response configuration

      • encoder

        Response encoder​(ContentType contentType,
                 java.lang.Class objectType,
                 java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object,​byte[]> encoder)
        Registers a response body encoder for this response, which will override any matching encoders configured globally (or shared).

        param contentType the response content-type to be encoded

        Parameters:
        contentType - the response content type to be encoded
        objectType - the response object type to be encoded
        encoder - the encoder function
        Returns:
        a reference to this response configuration

      • encoders

        Response encoders​(ResponseEncoders encoders)
        Registers the collection of shared encoders. Encoders registered on the response itself, will override these, but the shared encoders will override any matching global encoders.
        Parameters:
        encoders - the shared encoders to be applied
        Returns:
        a reference to this response configuration
